metadata.title: CVE-2022-39177 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
BlueZ before 5.59 allows physically proximate attackers to cause a denialof service because malformed and invalid capabilities can be processed inprofiles/audio/avdtp.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-39177` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bluetooth - 5.65-0ubuntu1
bluez - 5.65-0ubuntu1
bluez-cups - 5.65-0ubuntu1
bluez-hcidump - 5.65-0ubuntu1
bluez-meshd - 5.65-0ubuntu1
bluez-obexd - 5.65-0ubuntu1
bluez-source - 5.65-0ubuntu1
bluez-test-scripts - 5.65-0ubuntu1
bluez-test-tools - 5.65-0ubuntu1
libbluetooth3 - 5.65-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bluez package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.65-0ubuntu1').
